page.title: 16HOLTON AREA TREES, HEDGES
page.content: Trees and hedges in the area include ALMOND, one of the first trees to flower after Winter, the HORSECHESTNUT (schoolchildren gather the nuts in Autumn to play conkers).YEW is mostly found in Churchyards. HAWTHORN is fast growing and therefore used for hedgerows. HOLLY with its red berries in winter has long been the symbol of Christmas. Many ELM trees have been lost in recent years through Dutch Elm Disease. CYPRESS is very often used in gardens for hedges and LABURNUM is also a very popoular garden tree but its seeds are very poisonous. Other trees found include Ash, Oak, Silver Birch, Cherry, Sycamore, Willow, Walnut, Crab Apple, Poplar, Elder, Plum and Spruce.
